intro: Picris stricta, commonly known as upright sowthistle, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with a slender, upright stem and hairy foliage. Its yellow flowers bloom in the summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Picris stricta is often found in disturbed soils and can become invasive in certain regions.
